indieProjects.tagline: Your personal AI poker coach for home games
indieProjects.description: A mobile-first poker tracking  app that helps casual players improve their game. Built with React Native and Expo, featuring real-time game tracking, AI-powered insights, and beautiful visualizations. Shipped to both iOS App Store and Google Play Store.

features.description: Learn from detailed post-game analysis highlighting mistakes and missed opportunities

features.title: Statistics & Trends
features.description: Track your progress over time with beautiful charts showing win rates, position analysis, and more

architecture: Type-Safe Generic Middleware: Uses TypeScript generics `<T extends Response>` to create a reusable higher-order function that preserves return type safety while adding authentication logic to any API handler

Multi-Platform Token Strategy: Seamlessly handles both native mobile (Bearer token via Authorization header) and web (HTTP-only cookies) authentication in a single codebase without platform-specific code duplication

Granular Error Handling: Distinguishes between JWT expiration, invalid tokens, and verification errors using typed error classes from the `jose` library, enabling precise client-side error recovery strategies

Security Best Practices: Implements proper JWT verification with secret keys, extracts user context from validated tokens, and follows the principle of "fail closed" by defaulting to 401 Unauthorized on any authentication failure
performance: Built with Expo managed workflow for rapid iteration and over-the-air updates
Implemented offline-first architecture using AsyncStorage and sync queues
Modular component architecture with atomic design principles
Custom hook system for business logic separation and reusability
deployment: Set up EAS Build for cloud-based iOS and Android builds
Configured over-the-air updates with Expo Updates for instant bug fixes
Implemented staged rollouts to test updates with small user groups first
Automated App Store and Play Store submission process
tradeoffs: Chose Expo managed workflow for faster development over bare React Native for maximum control
Used Expo Api routes instead of custom backend to focus on mobile experience and ship faster
Implemented client-side analytics calculations to reduce backend costs (trade: slower initial load)
Limited offline functionality to core features to reduce complexity
challenges: Handling edge cases in game history parsing and validation
Optimizing chart rendering performance with large datasets
Managing app state across offline/online transitions
Balancing feature richness with app size constraints for mobile
learnings: Importance of designing for offline-first from day one
Value of comprehensive error boundaries and crash reporting (Sentry)
Mobile users expect instant feedback - optimistic updates are critical
App Store review process requires patience and attention to guidelines
